name: C. Pocket Book
statement:
One day little Vasya found mom’s pocket book. The book had names of her
friends and unusually enough, each name was exactly letters long. Let’s
number the names from to in the order in which they are written.As mom
wasn’t home, Vasya decided to play with names: he chose three integers ,
, (, ), then he took names number and and swapped their prefixes of
length . For example, if we take names "" and "" and swap their prefixes
with the length of , the result will be names "" and "".You wonder how
many different names Vasya can write instead of name number , if Vasya
is allowed to perform any number of the described actions. As Vasya
performs each action, he chooses numbers , , independently from the
previous moves and his choice is based entirely on his will. The sought
number can be very large, so you should only find it modulo .
editorial:
In this task, it was necessary to understand that in position Vasya can
get any name of a special form. More exactly, itâs the name of form = ,
where the first letter of any of the names, the second letter of any of
the names, -th letter of any of the names. Then the answer to the
problem is the product of (), where is a number of different letters in
the names placed in position .
